intro: Cyclanthera brevisetosa, commonly known as the short-setose cucumber, is a member of the Cucurbitaceae family. It is a climbing vine characterized by its hairy stems and small, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant. Its fruit is a small, green, elongated berry that matures to a yellowish color. Cyclanthera brevisetosa is native to tropical regions of South America and is often found in moist, shaded environments.
